channel.title: Pubky Knowledge Base
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Pubky Knowledge Base

item.title: readme
item.description: :brain: Pubky Knowledge Base Welcome to the Pubky Knowledge base - we are excited to have you here. üîó Access the Pubky Knowledge Base: notes.pubky,app! The current Knowledge base is a mix of reality, dreams, visions, actuality and plans.

item.title: index
item.description: Welcome to the Pubky Knowledge Base This is a knowledge base for the Pubky platform, which includes Pubky Core, PKARR and Pubky App. These documents are a work in progress, much like Pubky‚Äôs protocols and applications! What is Pubky? Pubky attempts to unlock the web by realizing our vision for a key-based, self-regulating web that puts users in control.

item.title: DHT
item.description: Distributed Hash Table - DHT It is a decentralized key-value store that allows for efficient data retrieval in a distributed system. Unlike traditional databases, DHTs do not rely on a central server to manage data.

item.title: DNS
item.description: Domain Name System - DNS It translates human-readable domain names (e.g., www.example.com) into IP addresses that computers use to identify each other on the network ...

item.title: DoH
item.description: DNS over HTTPS - DoH It is a security protocol that encrypts DNS queries and responses, enhancing privacy and security by preventing eavesdropping and tampering ...

item.title: HTTPS
item.description: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure - HTTPS It is an extension of HTTP that encrypts communication over a computer network, enhancing security and privacy ...

item.title: Key Pair
item.description: A cryptography key pair consists of two related but distinct cryptographic keys: Private Key: A secret key that is used to decrypt, sign, or authenticate data ...

item.title: Mainline DHT
item.description: Mainline DHT is a standard Distributed Hash Table (DHT) implementation widely used in the BitTorrent network, based on the Kademlia protocol. This decentralized system allows for efficient data storage and retrieval across a vast network of nodes, making it highly resilient and scalable.

item.title: Paykit
item.description: Paykit abstracts and automates any payment method behind a single, static public key. The public key belongs to a Pubky instance and points to a data store containing all supported payment endpoints.

item.title: Perspectives
item.description: Perspectives Users can save any custom-filtered view or feed as a ‚Äúperspective‚Äù which is basically a custom template of settings of tags, weights, users, reach, and trends ...
